overview: The CSS defines foundational design tokens, resets, typography, layout utilities, and accessibility helpers for a healthcare digital experience frontend. It establishes consistent spacing, color, and responsive grid behavior across sections like hero, services, and contact areas.
interactions: Hover and focus states for links and buttons
Responsive grid adjustments via media queries
Skip link focus visibility for keyboard navigation
data_flow: Layout and spacing tokens applied to section containers
Responsive breakpoints modify grid templates dynamically
accessibility: Skip link visibility on focus for screen readers
.visually-hidden class for hidden but accessible content
High contrast color tokens for dark/light themes
analytics: Potential hooks on navbar-brand click for navigation tracking
Skip-link usage metrics for accessibility engagement
Theme toggle events for user preference analytics
test_ideas: Verify skip-link becomes visible and navigates correctly on keyboard focus
Validate responsive grid column counts at breakpoints (640px, 768px, 1024px)
Check dark theme variable overrides apply correctly when [data-theme='dark'] is set
Ensure focus outlines appear on interactive elements (links, buttons, inputs)
Confirm container padding adjusts at defined media queries
Test navbar stickiness and shadow transitions on scroll
